metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.1 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 4 June to 17 September 2012. The site (100.35813° E, 38.89322° N) was located in a cropland (vegetable surface) in the Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1552.75 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.8 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (Gill&Li7500A) was 0.2 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software (Li-Cor Company, http://www.licor.com/env/products/ eddy_covariance/software.html), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, angle of attack correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月4日至9月17日的通量观测矩阵中1号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区农田内，下垫面是蔬菜地。观测点的经纬度是100.35813E, 38.89322N，海拔1552.75m。涡动相关仪架高3.8m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是20cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，角度订正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于估算在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下的蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在离地面4.5米处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，与EC系统的测量值相比，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance matrix' mean in terms of multiscale observation experiments?

Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance matrix in multiscale observation experiments refers to an arrangement of multiple eddy covariance towers that are strategically positioned to capture spatial variations in turbulent fluxes across a heterogeneous landscape. This setup allows researchers to study eco-hydrological processes over different scales and understand the interactions between various land surfaces, such as those found in oasis-desert systems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在多尺度观测实验中，涡动协方差矩阵指的是多个涡动协方差塔的排列，这些塔被战略性地布置在异质景观中，以捕捉湍流通量的空间变化。这种设置使研究人员能够研究不同尺度上的生态水文过程，并理解各种地表之间的相互作用，例如在绿洲-沙漠系统中发现的相互作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the challenges of measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes using eddy covariance systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出，在异质景观中使用涡度协方差系统测量蒸散发面临的挑战。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges of measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes using eddy covariance systems include the difficulty in capturing accurate surface fluxes due to the incomplete energy balance closure and the strong advective conditions present in irrigated agricultural areas. Additionally, errors in surface-air temperature differences, as well as image classification errors affecting component temperature estimation, may also impact the accuracy of the measurements.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中使用涡度协方差系统测量蒸散发的挑战包括由于能量平衡闭合不完全和灌溉农业区域存在强烈的平流条件，导致捕捉准确的表面通量变得困难。此外，表面与空气温度差异的误差，以及影响组分温度估计的图像分类错误，也可能影响测量的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的局限性主要源于图像分类中的错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，这些局限性可能还源于忽视大气上行辐射和透射率，以及在估计通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率时的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is the availability of multiscale observations considered a significant challenge for upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测的可用性被认为是对异质表面生态水文过程上升尺度的重大挑战，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The availability of multiscale observations is a challenge because it is crucial for capturing the complex interactions and processes on heterogeneous surfaces. Poor availability limits the ability to understand and model these interactions accurately, necessitating the development of experiments like HiWATER with instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain the required data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的可用性是一个挑战，因为它对于捕捉异质表面上复杂的相互作用和过程至关重要。可用性差限制了我们准确理解和建模这些相互作用的能力，因此需要开发像HiWATER这样的实验，采用分层嵌套尺度的仪器来获取所需的数据。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the implementation of a multiscale observation system affect the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测系统的实施如何影响对异质景观中生态水文过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The implementation of a multiscale observation system, such as the one used in the HiWATER experiment, enhances the understanding of eco-hydrological processes by capturing data across hierarchically nested scales. This approach allows researchers to observe and analyze multi-scale interactions between oasis and desert landscapes, improving the availability and accuracy of data for modeling and analysis.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测系统的实施，例如在HiWATER实验中使用的系统，通过捕获跨层次嵌套尺度的数据，增强了对生态水文过程的理解。这种方法使研究人员能够观察和分析绿洲与沙漠景观之间的多尺度相互作用，提高了建模和分析的数据可用性和准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of using a flux observation matrix combined with remote sensing techniques on the quality of eco-hydrological datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用通量观测矩阵结合遥感技术对生态水文数据集质量的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Combining a flux observation matrix with remote sensing techniques, such as LiDAR and thermal imaging, results in high-quality eco-hydrological datasets. These datasets benefit from comprehensive coverage and cross-validation, which are crucial for capturing the complexities of heterogeneous land surfaces. This approach ensures datasets are thoroughly quality controlled and accurate, facilitating more reliable eco-hydrological modeling and analysis.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将通量观测矩阵与遥感技术（如激光雷达和热成像）相结合，可以生成高质量的生态水文数据集。这些数据集受益于全面的覆盖和交叉验证，这对于捕捉异质土地表面的复杂性至关重要。这种方法确保数据集经过彻底的质量控制和准确性验证，从而促进更可靠的生态水文建模和分析。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to create a flux observation matrix using eddy covariance towers and other instruments in an oasis-desert area?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，使用涡度协方差塔和其他仪器创建通量观测矩阵的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of creating a flux observation matrix in an oasis-desert area is to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes through a hierarchically nested scale of instrumentation, which helps address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface. This is crucial for obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data, as evident from the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区创建通量观测矩阵的目标是通过分层嵌套的仪器规模捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，这有助于解决在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上升尺度的挑战。这对于获取多尺度和多学科的数据至关重要，正如HiWATER实验所表明的那样。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the purpose of utilizing a high-resolution thermal camera to measure soil and canopy component temperatures in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业区域中，利用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层成分温度的目的是为了。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The purpose of using a high-resolution thermal camera is to provide accurate inputs for the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which estimates evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in agricultural areas. This method allows for better validation of these parameters using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements, especially in strongly advection-irrigated regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪的目的是为双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型提供准确的输入，该模型用于估算农业地区的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。这种方法允许通过稳定的氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差测量对这些参数进行更好的验证，特别是在强烈的平流灌溉区域。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific procedures are used to preprocess eddy covariance flux data from a flux observation matrix to ensure data quality and accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保数据质量和准确性，从通量观测矩阵预处理涡度协方差通量数据所使用的具体程序包括哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The preprocessing of eddy covariance flux data involves several steps, including the removal of outliers, time delay correction, angle correction, coordinate rotation (secondary coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, quality evaluation is performed based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Data is also filtered to exclude erroneous instrument readings, data around precipitation events, data with a high missing rate, and weak turbulence data at night.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差通量数据的预处理涉及多个步骤，包括去除异常值、时间延迟校正、角度校正、坐标旋转（次级坐标旋转）、频率响应校正、超声波虚温校正和密度（WPL）校正。此外，还根据大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征进行质量评估。数据还会被过滤，以排除错误的仪器读数、降水事件周围的数据、高缺失率的数据以及夜间弱湍流数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale observations implemented to capture eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测是如何在异质景观中实施以捕捉生态水文过程的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are implemented using a hierarchically nested instrumentation approach. This includes establishing a flux observation matrix with eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Additionally, intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations are conducted. Instruments are arranged across different landscapes surrounding an oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland, to capture diverse eco-hydrological interactions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测采用分层嵌套的仪器方法。这包括建立一个通量观测矩阵，使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。此外，还进行强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。仪器分布在环绕绿洲的不同景观中，包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地，以捕捉多样的生态水文相互作用。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are employed to accurately partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾两个组成部分，采用了哪些数据收集方法？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components, ground-based measurement data, such as soil and canopy component temperatures obtained from thermal images, are used along with the Craig–Gordon model. The TSEB model is employed, utilizing high-resolution thermal camera inputs, and the component temperatures are calculated through classification of images into soil and canopy pixels. The thermal infrared temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and emissivity data, which are then validated against surface radiometric temperatures.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾两个组成部分，使用地面测量数据，如通过热成像获得的土壤和冠层组件温度，并结合Craig-Gordon模型。采用TSEB模型，利用高分辨率热像仪输入，通过将图像分类为土壤和冠层像素来计算组件温度。热红外温度通过入射长波辐射和发射率数据转换为辐射温度，然后与表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection methods contribute to the understanding and modeling of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多尺度和多学科的数据收集方法如何有助于理解和建模绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection methods contribute significantly by providing comprehensive datasets that include eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. These instruments capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and interactions between oasis and desert systems, as demonstrated in the HiWATER experiment.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多尺度和多学科的数据收集方法通过提供综合数据集显著贡献，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感。这些仪器捕捉了绿洲与沙漠系统之间的多尺度生态水文过程和相互作用，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the collection of multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces be challenging?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy. The uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference and errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures are significant factors affecting model performance.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为可用能量的能量平衡闭合不完全。表面与空气温度差的误差以及确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的错误是影响模型性能的重要因素。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in applying composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions for evapotranspiration estimation?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区应用复合温度分离方法进行蒸散发估算时，预期会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Errors in derived component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These challenges affect the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。推导的组成温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些挑战影响了蒸散发估算的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges encountered in the data collection for evapotranspiration studies over heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中进行蒸散发研究时，数据收集面临的主要挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection for evapotranspiration studies over heterogeneous landscapes include the limited effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches, particularly in arid regions. Errors in derived component temperatures are often caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy contribute to errors in Rn estimation. These challenges affect the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements and model estimations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中进行蒸散发研究的数据收集面临的挑战包括当前复合温度分离方法的有效性有限，特别是在干旱地区。派生的组成温度中的误差通常是由于图像分类错误造成的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，估计通过树冠的短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性也会导致Rn估计中的误差。这些挑战影响了蒸散发测量和模型估计的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the current datasets be expanded or refined to better address the challenges of modeling evapotranspiration in strongly advective environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据集可以通过哪些方式扩展或精炼，以更好地应对在强对流环境中建模蒸散发的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: To better address the challenges of modeling evapotranspiration in strongly advective environments, current datasets could be expanded by incorporating more precise measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, possibly through advances in thermal infrared camera technologies. Additionally, refining datasets to include more accurate classifications of soil and vegetation pixels can reduce errors in temperature estimation. Expanding the dataset to include a broader range of atmospheric conditions and vegetation types could also improve model robustness and reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 为了更好地应对强对流环境中蒸散发建模的挑战，可以通过引入更精确的土壤和冠层组分温度测量来扩展当前数据集，可能通过热红外相机技术的进步。此外，精细化数据集以包含更准确的土壤和植被像素分类可以减少温度估计中的误差。扩展数据集以包括更广泛的大气条件和植被类型也可以提高模型的稳健性和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss the challenges associated with effectively partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration over heterogeneous landscapes using remote sensing data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并讨论在异质景观中使用遥感数据有效划分蒸散发为蒸发和植物蒸腾所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the difficulty of measuring evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) on the ground, errors in derived component temperatures caused by image classification errors, and the uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy. Additionally, there are issues related to the strong advective environment affecting the performance of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, and the errors introduced by atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance that affect temperature estimation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括在地面上测量蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）的困难、由于图像分类错误导致的衍生组件温度的误差，以及通过树冠估计入射短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性。此外，还有与强对流环境相关的问题，这影响了像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的性能，以及大气上行辐射和透过率引入的误差，这些都影响了温度估计。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate and provide an overview of potential datasets that could be used to validate energy balance models in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查并提供潜在数据集的概述，这些数据集可以用于验证强对流灌溉农业地区的能量平衡模型。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include those from eddy covariance systems that measure turbulent fluxes, and datasets obtained from thermal infrared cameras that capture soil and canopy component temperatures. These datasets are used in combination with stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques to validate the ratios of evaporation to evapotranspiration (E/ET%) and transpiration to evapotranspiration (T/ET%) during multi-scale observation experiments. The datasets are collected from an experimental area covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards, and include data from various days of the year as part of the HiWATER-MUSOEXE project.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括测量湍流通量的涡动协方差系统的数据集，以及通过热红外相机捕捉土壤和冠层组分温度的数据集。这些数据集与稳定氧和氢同位素技术结合使用，以验证蒸发与蒸散（E/ET%）和蒸腾与蒸散（T/ET%）的比率，在多尺度观测实验中进行验证。这些数据集来自一个覆盖有玉米、蔬菜和果园的实验区域，并包括一年中不同天的数据，作为HiWATER-MUSOEXE项目的一部分。
